Sure! Here are some tips that may help you find a mentor within a company: 

1. Identify your goals: Before seeking out a mentor, it is important to understand what you want to achieve from the mentoring program. Knowing your objectives will help you find someone who can provide guidance and support in those areas. 2. Look for potential mentors: Once you have identified your goals, look for people who have experience and skills in those areas. These could be senior employees, respected leaders in the organization, or subject matter experts. 3. Establish a connection: Start by establishing a connection with the person you have identified as a potential mentor. Attend industry events, workshops, and meetings held at your company, introduce yourself, ask questions, and show a genuine interest in their work. 4. Ask for help: Ask the person for advice or feedback on a project you are working on, or for suggestions on how to improve your skills. This will not only show that you are willing to learn, but it will also demonstrate that you value their expertise. 5. Request formal mentorship: Once you have established a relationship and feel that the person would be a good mentor, ask them to be your formal mentor. This could be in the form of regular meetings, where they offer guidance on your career and personal development. Remember, finding a mentor can take time, and it's important to approach the process thoughtfully and with a clear idea of what you hope to gain from the partnership. Be proactive, open and explore as much as possible before selecting a mentor.
